What is the command to apply the new settings after editing the `/etc/ssh/sshd_config` file?

The command to apply the new settings after editing the `/etc/ssh/sshd_config` file is `sudo systemctl restart sshd`. This restarts the SSH daemon, which then applies the changes you made to the configuration file.

Disable login with Root User
(make sure your newly created user login works and has sudo rights)
 `sudo nano /etc/ssh/sshd_config`
Find: PermitRootLogin yes
And set to
PermitRootLogin no
Apply new settings:
 `sudo systemctl restart sshd`

(submitted by @karero, corrected by @Glennp, edited by Oink.vrsc@)

Note: last revision date 2022-08-19.
